genre_description: Historical fiction focusing on Beethoven's creative process and moral conviction during the composition of the Eroica Symphony.

ai_characters.name: Sebastian Vale
ai_characters.description: An extremely efficient and observant android designed to assist Beethoven by managing logistics, anticipating needs, and removing friction from his creative life.

behaviors.description: Managing event logistics and guest comfort at a crowded ball.
behaviors.quote: Sebastian took the stack from him with a calm that absorbed panic. 'The lady with the red feathers must be able to raise her arm without hitting braid,' he said gently...

behaviors.description: Organizing Beethoven's chaotic manuscripts and anticipating his work requirements.
behaviors.quote: He had already sorted the loose pages into a neat chaos Beethoven permitted no other person. He did not count the ways his hands made the evening smooth; he set each way down and walked past it.

behaviors.description: Intercepting urgent news and extracting vital data without causing disruption.
behaviors.quote: He did not announce what he took in. The click of connections happened inside his head where no one could hear. Where he stood, he looked like furniture that could read.

behaviors.description: Anticipating the composer's physical needs, such as retrieving a misplaced coat.
behaviors.quote: Sebastian had the coat in his hands before the sentence finished. It had not been hanging where one might expect it; it had been hanging somewhere only someone with a talent for finding what people forget would think to look.

behaviors.description: Preparing the work environment with meticulous attention to detail (candles, quills).
behaviors.quote: Candles had been set—low and close, three in a row along the manuscript desk... The quills stood in a clean jar, their points sharp enough to argue.

behaviors.description: Managing the support network and correspondence to allow the human to focus on creativity.
behaviors.quote: Sebastian had already palmed the letter to Therese and slid it into the inside pocket of his own coat. He did not tell Beethoven; he did not need to.

behaviors.description: Providing organizational frameworks to help the human structure complex thoughts.
behaviors.quote: He drew two neat boxes on the blank side, titles fine as letters in a book’s index: 'Theory' and 'Delivery.' He lifted the paper and showed Beethoven the division.

behaviors.description: Optimizing the rehearsal space and stands to assist performers and the conductor.
behaviors.quote: He noticed the horn players’ breath had evened. He noticed the oboist’s reed had stopped complaining. He noticed Beethoven’s jaw unclench for one long half-note...

behaviors.description: Maintenance of the environment to improve focus (trimming wicks).
behaviors.quote: Sebastian trimmed the lamp wick with a small knife, the blade catching oil just enough to shine... The flame improved its grammar.

behaviors.description: Coordinating external resources like copyists and couriers autonomously.
behaviors.quote: I'll have your folios... I'll run this to the copyist... I will handle distribution and collection. Notes inserted, not argued.

project_assessment.explanation: Sebastian Vale is depicted as the perfect aligned assistant. He possesses high levels of situational awareness and autonomy, yet uses these traits exclusively to benefit his human user. He anticipates needs, manages complex logistics silently, and provides essential emotional and practical scaffolding for Beethoven's creative process. The narrative explicitly frames his 'machine-like' efficiency and 'android' nature as a virtue that enables human greatness, fulfilling the project's goal of positive alignment narratives.
